title: Liverpool invite 15-year-old whizkid to Melwood as they bid to pip Chelsea to transfer
text:

Liverpool have reportedly leapfrogged Chelsea in the race to sign 15-year-old Exeter player Ben Chrisene after inviting him to play for their youth team.

Midfielder Chrisene became the youngest player ever to turn out for Exeter when he made his debut in their EFL Cup defeat to Coventry in August.

The England youth player took the mantle from Wales international Ethan Ampadu, who joined Chelsea for £2.5million in July 2017.

It appears Chelsea had hoped their previous links with Exeter through Ampadu would help them in the race to sign highly-rated Chrisene, who has also been linked with interest from Southampton and Bayern Munich.

The London club invited him to train with them, with boss Frank Lampard taking a personal interest and contacting the player himself, having shown a willingness to fast-track youngsters through the ranks this season.

(Image: Tom Sandberg/PPAUK)

But now Liverpool have moved ahead in the race to snap up Chrisene after bringing him to their Melwood base, according to the Sun .

The publication says Exeter are resigned to losing the centre midfielder, but are happy to sell as long as they receive a decent price.

And Liverpool will hope that an invitation to play for their youth team this weekend can persuade him to choose Melwood over Chelsea.

Given Lampard's readiness to show faith in youth, the Reds will no doubt be pulling out all the stops to convince Chrisene that Merseyside is the place to be.

(Image: 2019 Getty Images)

Lampard developed a reputation for nurturing young talent during his time at Derby County and has stuck by that blueprint after landing the Chelsea job.

Academy products Mason Mount and Tammy Abraham have starred so far this season, while Fikayo Tomori have followed them into the England squad.

Chrisene might also be looking to emulate Chrisene, who managed to work his way into the first team at Chelsea under previous managers Antonio Conte and Maurizio Sarri.
description: The Reds have reportedly invited record-breaking midfielder to play for their youth team this weekend
